Dear xrmx,

My goal is the same as #1498, but our idea is that ,
**First**,we build a session variable named as USER or ROLE in Caravel.
**Second**,we should have a customized database table named W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D,which has two core column ROLE,DEPARTMENT_ID.
**Then**,we develop a data-auth function in the Table ,with which we can join the table with W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D where W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D.DEPARTMENT_ID = table.department_id and W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D.ROLE =@{ROLE}.

Before the Caravel,we have implemented Oracle BIEE,SAP BO for several years,we have tried many type data-auth in BIEE or SAP ,but the above is the best one.

@ganshanshan my goal is to have different users (with different levels of permissions) be able to query  the same Postgres table or view. This will allow us to centralize access management within Caravel, and not split it between Caravel and within Postgres. 

I don't expect that the same slice is used; I expect that different users with different permissions will have access to different slices.

Second,we should have a customized database table named W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D,which has two core columns ROLE,DEPARTMENT_ID.
Then,we develop a data-auth function in the Table ,with which we can join the table with W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D where W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D.DEPARTMENT_ID = table.department_id and W_AUTH_DEPARTMENT_D.ROLE =@{ROLE}.

As discussed, this PR adds a lot of complexity (caching, decorators, async autocomplete, ...) and can lead to a degradation of user experience in some cases:

case 1: a user has a Postgres DB with hundreds of schemas and thousand of tables for which loading the cache takes 15 seconds, and no cron job to constantly warm up the cache has been setup, or is down for some reason. Every 2 minutes, hitting the table selection dropdown will take 15 seconds, even if they had selected a schema

case 2: that same user run a "create table as" statement and wants to work off of this summary, wants to add the new table to the workspace, hits the dropdown, tables were cached before, table is missing

I'd lean towards keeping the current working pre-schema flow untouched, and setting up caching only where needed (cross schema lookup) and maybe parameterize it (switch it on on a per-database basis).
Another thought that may invalidate some assumptions: does simplecache work across gunicorn workers? I think not.

If that doesn't work, I suggest checking out this Stack Overflow post. This worked for me on Windows (using Python 3.5)

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26505882/unable-to-install-sasl-0-1-3-python-package-on-windows-machine/35985464#35985464?newreg=7146fc4d2bc1435b8135a3140e478c40

I just rebased and this doesn't seem to work as it should. There's a scrollbar inside a scrollbar. Meaning once you scroll down the panel, the page starts to scroll. That's the whole `height: 100%` doesn't work thing. You have to either use position:absolute or use javascript to compute the height of the section.
This change breaks the travis build.

@kkalyan I moved from Yahoo to Glassdoor while working on Caravel :) Was able to hack the code to implement query time lookups in Caravel. Basically you will need to modify the query function (where the actually query gets formulated). I modified it to use map function and it worked.  I'll talk to Maxime to see what is his thought on this and we may want to engineer it properly to be used by everyone.
Seconded. I'm very interested in this feature being added.

I just added support for `dimensionsSpec` here https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1545 which exposes ways to do specify mapping on a per-column basis:
http://druid.io/docs/latest/querying/dimensionspecs.html

To use it, you have to create a new calculated column on the datasource and paste your valid `dimensionSpec` expression in the text box.

You can define your mapping as a hard coded JSON object in our dimensionSpec, and it also looks like you can define "namespace" mappings that are stored on all the nodes on the Druid cluster and you can reference them in `dimensionSpec`.
http://druid.io/docs/latest/querying/lookups.html

Maybe a complementary feature on the Caravel would be for a way to manage your Druid Lookups in Caravel and have Caravel sync them with the Druid cluster. This is not on our current roadmap but we get to it at some point.
That's supported already, there's a configuration flag to "allow DML" at the database level

We can't keep all queries result in the application's state on the client side as it would blow up. When using the results backend (async mode) it's possible to re-fetch the results easily. When not using the results backend, users have to re-run the query.
Would it be possible to set a limit (either time-based or # of queries based) to save the results?  Say for 1 hour or for the last 5 queries?
awesome!
This should work as long as "Allow DML" is true
Which browser is that?
Is "Allow DML" on by default?

The color change augments the chance of catching the user's eye for this feature's discovery. The label change by itself on a button is pretty subtle, it'd be easy not to notice it. Are you concerned that the color change makes it look to "alarming"?

@toabey ,thanks to your tips, solved my problem, but the dashboard is still blank ,and browser console show the error, all related about dataTable, i find that in the dist js files, for example, in dist/dashboard.xx.js, the datatable.net.bs is loaded as AMD:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7539662/20044200/b5d1996c-a4d1-11e6-9d79-7ae57fb571a2.png)

the if statement get a true const, but in datatable.net.bs's node modules, the if statement is a express as "typeof define === 'function' && define.amd", the npm run dev replace the express as 'true' in output dist js, i attemp to modify it as false in dist js file, and then it works well, but i don't know what cause the issue. i find other js error almost the same related to datatable in webpack:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7539662/20044263/5e64bdca-a4d2-11e6-8c84-961e3fcfd968.png)

Sorry I forgot to exclude query results from storing result data in local state, [https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/1552](url) should solve it.
VisualizeModal needs the column information, but not the data, perhaps ResultSet should only cache `results.data`, not the whole `results` object that also contains the column info

Yes, It supposed to be DATE(`inputDate`) not "inputDate", I'm using MySQL.
When I use TIME SERIES chart and use Time Granularity to format my date, like use week, then the query of timestamp part will be 

> DATE(DATE_SUB("inputDate", INTERVAL DAYOFWEEK("inputDate") - 1 DAY)) AS timestamp,

It will use "" but not `` and thus return nothing.
